docs.text: for a good ten years or so , super cool chow yun fat has enjoyed god hood status in the hong kong action scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now , he has followed in the footsteps of director john woo , ( who launched chow's super stardom in the acclaimed 'a better tomorrow' ) by moving to hollywood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i had some reservations about this move and it would seem i was right to have them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chow plays a hitman who is doing jobs in order to repay a debt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his final job requires him to kill a policeman's seven year old boy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this he refuses do and runs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , he is forced into a violent confrontation when his family are threatned and replacement killers are brought in to do the job .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cue around 80 minutes of various and quite frankly tedious shoot- outs which take place in various locations .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some thought had gone into making them a bit different but unfortunately they end up being just plain boring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the car wash scene , i found myself laughing at how stupid it looked .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tut tut .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the emphasis during the constant action seemed to be on the accompanying music , ( i could have sworn one piece was ripped out of a bruckheimer movie ) and not on the content .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mia sorvino ( a passport forger ) is dragged into the affay and also provides a lame love interest as well as being rather handy with a gun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director antoine arqua has clearly not observed chow's excellent acting capabilties and simply requires him to mutter a few lines of broken english and look flash as he stands and shoots .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chow's trademark of twin pistol shooting is saved for the finale ( which in fairness is quite good ) and there's not even a toothpick in site .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and as for making chow shoot like a cop , well that's damned unforgiveable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to round up , the replacement killers is a pretty darned lame first outing for chow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it would appear he has left asia for a 90 minute pop video .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is not what we wanted at all , considering john woo was the exec producer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( did he have no say so at all ? )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: watch 'the killer' again and weep at the difference .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: review by chris hill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " there's room at the top , they are telling you still , but first you must learn how to smile as you kill , if you want to be like the folks on the hill . "
docs.label: negative
